greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Antisigma(n): Sum of the numbers less than n that do not divide n.
comment: a(n) is the sum of proper non-divisors of n, the row sum in triangle A173541. - _Omar E. Pol_, May 25 2010
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (n mod k) + (-n mod k). (End)
G.f.: x/(1 - x)^3 - Sum_{k>=1} k*x^k/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 18 2017
example: a(12)=50 as 5+7+8+9+10+11 = 50 (1,2,3,4,6 not included as they divide 12).
mathematica: Table[n(n + 1)/2 - DivisorSigma[1, n], {n, 55}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
program: (MAGMA) [n*(n+1) div 2- SumOfDivisors(n): n in [1..60]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 29 2015
results.author: Paul Jobling (paul.jobling(AT)whitecross.com)
